Text: Check out the staff’s proposal to our Commissioners on revising how we evaluate generic environmental issues for license renewals. After the Commission votes, we’ll open up the opportunity for comment and hold public meetings. https://t.co/rEjySCDvZH

We’ve told Abilene Christian University we’re aiming for May 2024 to complete our review of the school’s application to build its Molten Salt Research Reactor. Our letter to ACU provides the details: https://t.co/ctLqQqmcwO
#NRCNews: We’re proposing a fine to a Wyoming medical center for violations of our requirements associated with their use of #radioactive materials. https://t.co/szWLsJhdsI

#NRCNews: We’re asking for comments on generic environmental issues for Duke Energy’s application for a second renewal of operating licenses for the Oconee #nuclear power plant. https://t.co/OOVQdOaZ3P
#NRCNews: We’re seeking public input on the scope of our environmental review for the proposed TRISO-X nuclear fuel fabrication facility to be built in Oak Ridge, Tennessee. https://t.co/TGtnIUxCBE

NRC Commissioner Annie Caputo visited Southern Nuclear plants in Alabama and Georgia recently. Her trip down south included Hatch, Farley and Vogtle plants, where she toured areas including control and spent fuel rooms. She met with resident inspectors and Southern Nuclear execs. https://t.co/hJzkEz0MbE

If you’re interested in #nuclear power or materials and can manage complex documents and meet tight deadlines, apply for our licensing assistant positions. Find more info on our “Careers” web page and the link to USAJobs under “Opportunities.” https://t.co/dYAUzIBP1u  #NRCHires https://t.co/kBQhW1pK0T
#NRCNews: We've proposed a fine for a Connecticut hospital for violations related to the facility's #radiation safety program. https://t.co/SAx7jxYDSy

#NRCNews: We’ve named David Skeen as the new director of our Office of International Programs. OIP develops and implements international nuclear safety, security and nonproliferation activities and licenses export/import of nuclear materials and equipment. https://t.co/Duj62WcgwU

#NRCNews: We’ve selected David L. Pelton as the new director of our Office of Enforcement, effective Jan. 1. The enforcement office develops and oversees policies and programs for enforcement and allegations. https://t.co/Q5NqyNb1jj

#NRC Chair Christopher Hanson met with French President Emmanuel Macron last week at the Ambassador’s residence in Washington, D.C., for a bilateral workshop on #nuclear cooperation. Chair Hanson spoke about our nuclear safety focus and research initiatives. https://t.co/lBziGAKG5d
Join us Dec.13 as we discuss the regulatory basis for a rulemaking on nonemergency event notifications. We’ll take comments separately and will describe how you can comment. https://t.co/L07p3vCa8H

Earlier this year, a panel came together at our annual Regulatory Information Conference to discuss the unique characteristics of the molten salt reactor fuel cycle, including fabrication, transportation, storage and used fuel management. Check it out at https://t.co/seE2yZM2vg

We recently held a webinar to discuss emergency planning and security requirements for #nuclear plants undergoing #decommissioning. You can watch the video of the meeting on our YouTube channel. https://t.co/JUvMqPxvks

NRC HQ staff member Ata Istar and Region I’s Paul Cataldo and Mel Gray were #OntheJob at the #decommissioning Indian Point plant for an inspection of the installation of a first-of-its-kind crane, which allows for the speedier transfer of dry casks loaded with spent nuclear fuel. https://t.co/4QD6pCtjzq

Veronica Fisher and Seamus Flanagan, participants in our Nuclear Regulator Apprenticeship Network program, are #OntheJob at the Seabrook nuclear power plant learning the ins and outs of being the agency’s eyes and ears from Resident Inspector Travis Daun. https://t.co/D7IyLpqkYg

We’ve amended the construction permit for the SHINE Medical Isotope Production Facility being built in Wisconsin. We approved a request to extend the completion date to the end of 2025, as well as change the name on the permit to SHINE Technologies, LLC. https://t.co/zTXaXXAsxO

The agency also plans to hold public meetings near the plant to discuss the environmental impact statement for 
the license renewal.
#NRCNews: We’ve announced an opportunity to request a hearing on the application to renew the operating license of Comanche Peak #nuclear power plant near Glen Rose, Texas. https://t.co/YMYyWbqKbJ

We have job openings for #healthphysicists. Join our team to perform routine and complex #radiation protection inspections and license reviews. Our “Careers” web page has information and the link to the USAJobs posting under “Opportunities.”  https://t.co/dYAUzIBP1u #NRCHires https://t.co/NdD82vbMdY

Congratulations to these universities awarded NRC research and development grants:
@virginia_tech @WSUPullman @UCLA @UF @UTKnoxville @NCState @RITtigers @LSU @PittTweet @UofIllinois @rpi @UNM @unevadareno @NotreDame @OhioState @penn_state @LifeAtPurdue @UMaine
#NRCNews: We’re awarding 20 research and development grants totaling nearly $10 million under the University Nuclear Leadership Program. https://t.co/vNKeMc5E7O

We join the nation in celebrating #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth. We put together a short video celebrating the meaningful partnerships the NRC has with Tribal Nations and the work of our Native American colleagues who support our safety and security mission. #INDIGENOUS https://t.co/pe2trw6pII

Our inspectors were in Alaska to inspect five companies that use fixed #nuclear gauges and portable nuclear devices for various purposes, including measuring the level of oil and flow rates and checking pipes for indications of corrosion or cracking. https://t.co/DpW34jcxBP

Mary Muessle, a director in our Region IV office, and inspectors James Thompson and Kyle Bischoff were #OntheJob at Alaska’s North Slope, site of one of the world’s largest oil deposits. https://t.co/8o97VP1jgU

Join us for a webinar, Dec. 12, on the future of the National Materials Program. Topics will include the continued need for consistency and collaboration, sustaining fair and equitable fee structures and the impact of emerging technologies. https://t.co/9ZjVtPb0VJ https://t.co/jEvIG12yYD
Have a safe and happy Thanksgiving Day holiday! https://t.co/qjJhoOBCtE
#NRCNews: We’ve scheduled a webinar on November 30 to discuss emergency preparedness and security requirements for #nuclear power plants undergoing #decommissioning. https://t.co/oQRFUxqLxp

We’re updating our drug testing regulations for #nuclear workers to add prescription opioids and ecstasy-type drugs and to make it easier to detect cheaters. These and other changes at https://t.co/ynSusHUFHd https://t.co/STA47LKhQL
#NRCNews: We’ve named a new senior resident inspector at the Cooper nuclear power plant in Nebraska. https://t.co/Ki2RLpzI9l

Alexus is working on becoming qualified to review license applications to possess and use #nuclear materials. Through our NRAN program, a paid, full-time training program, Alexus got hands-on experience and enjoyed the supportive environment of the NRC. #STEMCareers #WomeninSTEM

Alexus Willis, a health physicist in our Region IV office in Texas, worked and studied hard to earn a spot on the NRC team. She participated in our intern/co-op student programs while studying nuclear, radiological health and biomedical engineering at Texas A&M. @TAMU. #NRCHires https://t.co/1d1g23yRhN
#NRCNews: We’ve appointed a new resident inspector at New Jersey’s Salem nuclear power plant. https://t.co/ldpRabdveJ
#NRCNews: We’ve named a new resident inspector at the Watts Bar #nuclear power plant in Tennessee. https://t.co/xDmFUzS9oY

NRC Chair Christopher Hanson, on a visit last week to Mexico, met with the head of Mexico’s #nuclear regulator Alejandro Nunez-Carrera to renew the bilateral arrangement between our organizations and discuss #nuclear safety and security issues of mutual interest. https://t.co/xowOMStZoC

#NRCNews: We’ve accepted for review a construction permit application from Abilene Christian University to build its Molten Salt Research Reactor facility on the university’s campus in Texas. https://t.co/r4KJSteovw

#DidYouKnow there are more than a few ways to hear from us? You can catch us on Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn, and can sign up for email updates about news releases and public meetings. Just click on the links on our website homepage. https://t.co/VkpPofAhMA https://t.co/52seNnNiCf

We’re busy preparing for #NRCRIC2023 in March. In the meantime, take a look back at a technical session, with our Chair Christopher Hanson moderating, from the 2022 conference on preapplication engagement for new and #advancedreactors. https://t.co/qibZ1Qs87T

Congrats to three of our senior officials, Ray Furstenau, Raymond Lorson and Anita Louise Lund, on being recognized by President Biden with the 2022 Presidential Rank Award/Meritorious Executive for “sustained accomplishments” over the course of their distinguished careers. https://t.co/JEGyDLhe0l

#NRCNews: We’re seeking comment on the scope of our supplemental environmental impact statement for the application for a second renewal of operating licenses for the North Anna #nuclear power plant. https://t.co/WBEHeRdBpi

We're still working on the “paperless office," but like other federal agencies, we have a robust recycling program. Though our efforts were hampered by COVID, we mark #AmericaRecyclesDay and continue our efforts as public servants and citizens of the world to make green choices. https://t.co/bRYt1YU5aV

We've issued our Fiscal Year 2022 Agency Financial Report. It details our stewardship of public resources during the 12 months ending Sept. 30, as we ensure the safe use of commercial #nuclear technology. https://t.co/YHsZQPJ2No
#NRCSpeech: Read our Chair’s remarks for the Mexican Nuclear Society Conference. https://t.co/VCGG9kp2NO

Do you have skills in training and professional development and experience using a Learning Management System? If so, apply for our Training Program Specialist position by Nov. 22. Visit our web page for the link to USAJobs under “Opportunities.” https://t.co/dYAUzICmR2 #NRCHires https://t.co/2IcIGxiwyA
#NRCNews: Under a settlement with our agency, a West Virginia hospital system will take corrective actions related to nuclear medicine activities performed at the facility. https://t.co/pZypuwyJ5h

On #VeteransDay we honor the those who’ve served in the U.S. military. We’re grateful for the veterans working to help carry out our safety mission. We're highlighting a few, including Joseph Goodridge, who sang the national anthem at an NRC Veterans Day event earlier this week. https://t.co/5J9sjDHNub

Anne Marie analyzes/reconciles accounts to prepare the Report on Budget Execution and Budgetary Resources and prepares our information for the Data Transparency Program, which makes federal financial data available throughout the government. #NRCHires

Anne Marie Emerich has a knack for numbers -- a well- suited skill for a newly hired accountant and appropriately highlighted in honor of #InternationalAccountingDay. She has 17 years’ experience in accounting at other federal agencies and now puts those skills to work for us. https://t.co/PhHUdXePzl

Our Commission recently met with experts from U.S. and U.K. governments, academia, and commercial and philanthropic organizations to discuss regulatory approaches to #fusion technology. View the full briefing at https://t.co/lbfTl7QmUC https://t.co/SiFetWqpJE

We’ve checked on materials license holders and the permanently shut down Crystal River plant to confirm they’ve taken steps to weather the storm. We’re in contact with Florida's regulatory authorities about #radioactive materials users under their Agreement State jurisdiction.

St. Lucie plant workers have gone through their storm preparation procedures and our resident inspectors are independently verifying their actions. We’ve sent additional inspectors to assist the resident inspectors and will staff our Region II Incident Response Center as needed.

We’re keeping an eye on #Nicole as the storm moves toward Florida today, with an expected landfall in the early hours Thursday as a strong #tropicalstorm or a Category 1 hurricane, not far from the Saint Lucie #nuclear power plant. https://t.co/lU7B3lh8Yc

While Andrew and Drew are transplants to #Louisiana, they’re happy to call the state their home as they serve at the agency’s “eyes and ears” at the plant. They spend their days conducting inspections on site and representing the agency in the community.

#NationalLouisianaDay celebrates all that makes the state unique like jazz and Mardi Gras. But today, we're highlighting our resident inspectors, Andrew Patz and Drew Childs, who work at the Waterford nuclear power plant – in St. Charles Parish about 25 miles west of New Orleans. https://t.co/lzwkP9QcZj

Our head of operations Dan Dorman, and staff members Shawn Smith and Shana Helton were in Canada this week participating in the NEA/Natural Resources Canada #workshop on Management of Spent Fuel, #Radioactive Waste and #Decommissioning in #SMRs or Advanced Reactor technologies. https://t.co/8OIWOG5EiW

Michelle was @SouthernU_BR, her alma mater, for a recruitment event talking about her work to students in the physics program and about balancing academic excellence with extracurricular activities with the school’s marching band and dance team. #NRPPW

We’re happy to recognize the important work of our #healthphyicists for #NationalRadiationProtectionProfessionalsWeek, including Michelle Hammond. She’s worked as an inspector license reviewer and teaches materials licensing at our Technical Training Center. https://t.co/OiA1Vz1Wpv

Our Chair Christopher Hanson visited @GeorgiaTech nuclear engineering program, where he interacted with students, pitched the NRC as a future employer and checked out some additive manufacturing test samples, produced by the university’s Advanced Manufacturing Pilot Facility. https://t.co/gJGIFVCpMm
#NRCNews: We will be conducting a special inspection at the University of Texas at Austin to evaluate the use of improper fuel at their research #reactor. https://t.co/X4pMO7JxdG

Join us for #NRCRIC2023, our largest public meeting, on March 14-16 as we discuss “Navigating the Nuclear Future,” with expert panelists from our agency, as well as industry, academia and the community. https://t.co/C9FRfnAIIT

Our Notice of Funding Opportunity for Minority Serving Institutions is open until December 9. This opportunity is for faculty and student programs related to #nuclear safety, security, and other fields relevant to our mission. Get more information at https://t.co/L8g91Zu8UF https://t.co/2KUTnXi4zz
#NRCNews: We published our annual report to Congress detailing the prior year’s security inspection program. https://t.co/54YKsYzHMJ

Communicate to the public and media about the work of our agency AND perform high-level administrative work as an NRC Public Affairs Specialist. Visit our “Careers” web page and click the “Opportunities” link to find more information. https://t.co/dYAUzICmR2 #NRCHires https://t.co/tTeC2y2638
#NRCNews: We’ve announced NRC headquarters and regional leadership appointments. https://t.co/LMqkonMi48

Columbia #nuclear plant Resident Inspector Amber Donley used her Ph.D. in radiochemistry to make “Monster Toothpaste” from a few household items for the “Spooky Science” educational demonstration hosted by @GirlScoutsEWNI. #HappyHalloween https://t.co/9e9a8TX8yr

North American regulators met up at the @iaeaorg  #nuclear power conference in Washington, D.C., today, including NRC Commissioners Jeff Baran and Annie Caputo, @CNSC_CCSN President and CEO Rumina Velshi, and NRC Chair Christopher Hanson. https://t.co/DRwlMg4gwR

In his remarks, Chair Hanson focused on the critical role of regulators in ensuring new #nuclear technologies are deployed safely and securely, NRC’s collaboration with @CNSC_CCSN and the ongoing safe operation of the current fleet overseen by competent, independent regulators.

Our Chair Hanson participated in a panel today on regulatory oversight at the @iaeaorg  International Nuclear Power in the 21st Century Conference in D.C., with officials from the United Kingdom, Canada, Finland and GE Hitachi Nuclear Energy. https://t.co/qajhVLmyBP

At the @iaeaorg International Nuclear Power in the 21st Century Conference in Washington, D.C., @JeffBaranNRC meets with Mark Foy of the UK’s Office for Nuclear Regulation to discuss new reactors and NRC-ONR cooperation. https://t.co/kMk5PsuuA5

We recently held an event for #NDEAM. NRC Commissioner Jeff Baran expressed appreciation for the contributions of our employees with disabilities. Special thanks to guest speakers Tara Rhea from @OhioState  and Leah Zimmerman from @penn_state for insightful presentations. https://t.co/zdlYtACKiw

Our two newest NRC Commissioners, Annie Caputo and Bradley Crowell, take a moment together while attending the @iaeaorg International Nuclear Power in the 21st Century Conference being held in Washington, D.C., this week. https://t.co/txIqStA2wd
The conference brings together countries from around the world to discuss #nuclear energy in the coming decades. Chair Hanson will speak on a regulatory panel later in the week.

NRC Chair Hanson and @ENERGY Secretary Granholm stand with other dignitaries and staff on the first day of the @iaeaorg International Nuclear Power in the 21st Century Conference held in Washington, D.C., beginning today. https://t.co/WsIZo1Hquh

Dan and Andres quantify the costs and benefits to the public, licensees and the agency of potential new regulations, an important – and complicated – calculation that feeds into the final Commission decision. More on NRC job openings and careers at https://t.co/dYAUzIkdCU.

Some of our new #NRCHires come with years of experience, including cost analysts Dan Ruby and Andres Orozco Restrepo. They joined us this spring from other federal agencies. They’ve found interesting work, great mentors and the training needed to do their new NRC jobs well. https://t.co/3DJvI2GRgr

NRC’s Candace Spore, LaDonna Suggs, Theresa Clark and Susan Salter were #OntheJob at the @AISES national conference, which hosted more than 1500 indigenous professionals, college and high school students, to talk about our job opportunities and critical mission. #IndigenousinSTEM https://t.co/wczBGzqzTr

#SavetheDate for #NRCRIC2023 March 14-16. The conference theme is “Navigating the Nuclear Future.” The in hybrid in person and online event is free and open to the public. Stay tuned for more details, including registration and program agenda information. https://t.co/PbkRu4B8vg

Apply conventional investigative techniques, laws of evidence and rules of criminal procedures to investigations associated with the nuclear industry. Submit resumes for criminal investigator/special agent – OPM job series 1811 (GG13-15) – to NRC_OI_Resumes.Resource@nrc.gov

#DidYouKnow #NRCHires criminal investigators/special agents? Experienced investigators will team up with our technical staff to conduct investigations of alleged violations of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954. Read the full job requirements here https://t.co/6dKndepVjt https://t.co/IgNMZthLat

Good news! You can now find us on Instagram. We’ll use the platform to post photos, short videos and graphics with a focus on the skilled and diverse employees who carry out our mission. Check it out at https://t.co/vQ6AZDBM4O https://t.co/EkqaImwQDk

As an employee, Marla can take advantage of training and career growth opportunities. She brings her valuable life and professional experience to our important safety mission every day. Visit our “Careers” web page at https://t.co/dYAUzICmR2

Marla believes in what we do and is supported by top-notch NRC supervisors and colleagues while developing environmental reviews for licensing and rulemaking activities for nuclear materials programs. #STEMCareers

In honor of #HispanicHeritageMonth, we’re focusing this week’s #NRCHires spotlight on Marla Morales. In August, she went from NRC contractor to federal civil servant when she accepted a job as one of our environmental project managers. #WomeninScience https://t.co/s3X5iJ5LyF

NRC Commissioner @JeffBaranNRC and @CNSC_CCSN President and CEO Rumina Velshi tour Canada’s Darlington Nuclear Generating Station, discussing the CANDU #reactor as well as the two agencies’ work on #advancedreactors and #SMRs. https://t.co/v5m8fTL0hC

NRC Commissioner Annie Caputo tours the control room of Unit 2 at Nine Mile Point #nuclear power plant on a tour through parts of Region 1, which also included visits to the Ginna and Susquehanna sites, her first plant visits since returning to the Commission in August. https://t.co/MvYSLRYLjW

In honor of the U.S. Navy Birthday, created #OnthisDay in 1775, we’re highlighting Trish Walker Webb. Recommended by a friend to apply with the NRC, Anny is excited about the hands-on training and opportunities for career development. The people she’s met have helped her feel confident she’s made a good choice. More about working at the NRC is at: https://t.co/dYAUzIBP1u

Check out the video we unveiled at the U.S. booth, part of the exhibits by Member States at the #IAEAGC. In it we discuss the importance of a competent, independent regulator to help ensure success of a nation’s peaceful use of nuclear technologies. https://t.co/KRAssEC6Yq

The debris is left over from when a fuel element partially melted in February 2021. Once NIST submits its modification request we’ll review it to ensure the change will continue to protect the public.

Join us Oct. 7 as we discuss part of NIST’s effort to satisfy us it’s safe to restart its research reactor. NIST wants to modify the reactor license to deal with a very small amount of debris in the #reactor coolant system. https://t.co/vqKnWllbEJ https://t.co/fLYWZBFTox

#NRCNews: Our Commission has approved placing the state of Mississippi on probation for deficiencies in its agreement state program regulating the use of #radioactive materials; the deficiencies do not pose an immediate risk to public health and safety. https://t.co/aVtxPWxXNI

Our Chair is active in this international group of head regulators, which seeks to increase the number of women in the #nuclear workforce and in the pipeline. He is also taking steps closer to home to prioritize #genderequity and #diversity initiatives at our agency.

NRC Chair Christopher Hanson had a very busy schedule this week at the #IAEAGC, including participating in the 5th International Gender Impact Group on Gender Equality in Nuclear Regulatory Agencies meeting. https://t.co/pEZ6j00Moe

We’re watching #HurricaneIan as it moves through Florida today. While no #nuclear power plants are expected to be adversely impacted, plant workers have gone through storm preparation procedures and our resident inspectors are verifying their actions to assure they’re prepared. https://t.co/hCFRizcdGj

NRC Chair Christopher Hanson will have nearly 20 meetings with regulatory counterparts and IAEA officials at the #IAEAGC. International cooperation helps strengthen #nuclear safety and security around the world.

Our Chair Christopher Hanson is in Vienna this week at the #IAEAGC for presentations, informal discussions and bilateral agreement signings. The #IAEAGC is held each year so Member States can discuss issues affecting the IAEA’s work priorities and budget. https://t.co/ZuKIkOUP5V

The irradiation process is regulated by the Food and Drug Administration, which approves foods to be irradiated, and the U.S. Department of Agriculture, which certifies irradiation facilities.

For decades, certain foods have been irradiated to kill pathogens such as Ecoli and prevent food-borne illnesses. Many foods are sanitized this way without harm to their flavor or nutritional value. Importantly, the food doesn't become #radioactive.

It's #WorldFoodSafetyDay, and you may not know it but we have a part to play in keeping what we eat safe. We and the Agreement States license irradiators using gamma radiation from a sealed #radioactive source such as cobalt-60 or cesium-137. https://t.co/DF67tQfTGv

In 1975, Elizabeth Briggs Johnson joined the NRC’s Atomic and Safety and Licensing Board Panel and served until her retirement in 1996, making her the longest serving woman in ASLBP history. #WomensHistoryMonth

Elizabeth Briggs Johnson was the first woman certified as a senior reactor operator on ORNL’s “swimming pool” research #reactor. And she was a charter member of the ANS, receiving a posthumous Standards Service Award for work on criticality safety standards. #WomensHistoryMonth

For #WomensHistoryMonth, we’re highlighting Elizabeth “Libby” Briggs Johnson, a physicist who worked on the Manhattan Project. After the war, while many women were receiving pink slips, she joined the @ORNL Nuclear Division. https://t.co/c2LlxU0Hr7

Interesting fact, Maryland’s Calvert Cliffs was the first #nuclear power plant to receive renewed operating licenses. To find out about safety performance at the plant visit our website at https://t.co/n8r9IaYTQu #MarylandDay

Each of the #reactor cores at Maryland’s Calvert Cliffs is licensed for a maximum output of 2,737 MWt. The Unit 1 and 2 reactors’ operating licenses were issued in 1974 and 1976 respectively and each has been renewed and will expire in 2034 and 2036. #MarylandDay

Today is #MarylandDay. For NRC #eLearning we’re spotlighting the state’s only #nuclear power plant, Calvert Cliffs. Located 40 miles south of Annapolis, in Lusby, Md., the site, owned by Constellation Energy, has two pressurized water #reactors. https://t.co/arlmbf7BYO

Quiz Answers:

1. An artificially made, radioactive element that has an atomic number higher than uranium in the periodic table of elements such as neptunium, plutonium, americium, and others.
2. Plutonium 
3. Radium

- What is a Transuranic element? 
- Which element is created if an atom of uranium-

- Which element was included in many consumer and medical products in the early 1900s and notorious for fatally sickening watch-dial painters?

West, NRC: Our social media post on weather conditions causing nuclear facilities in North Carolina to shut down have been picked up by traditional media amplifying our information to the public . #NRCRIC2019
West, NRC: We've communicated to the public during severe weather events with information  on what our staff and resident inspectors are doing throughout the storm. #NRCRIC2019
West, NRC: We’ve integrated the use of social media into emergency preparedness exercises understanding that it would be a key to successfully communicating in a crisis. #NRCRIC2019
West, NRC: We use a creative approach to disguise education as entertainment, such as our "Guess the Nuclear Term" on Twitter. #NRCRIC2019
West, NRC:  Communication is a balanced content concept ,we can get to know the people who work at the NRC. We are not a faceless bureaucracy #NRCRIC2019
NRC’s Stephanie West emphasizes the usefulness of using social media for conveying agency’s commitment to safety and transparency. #NRCRIC2019

Peng, AEC : More information will bring about more acceptance of nuclear power by the public. Public, journalist and government collaboration will  help prevent the spread of misinformation. #NRCRIC2019
Peng, AEC : Survey of public opinion told us we need to improve public understanding of nuclear use and government's nuclear policy. #NRCRIC2019
Chih-wei Peng, Atomic Energy Council, Taiwan, notes that keys to keeping public informed include enhancing public trust in government. #NRCRIC2019
Moonsamy, NNR: Nuclear Communication is not a luxury, but a must. #NRCRIC2019

Moonsamy, NNR : A 2016 fire near the only nuclear power plant in South Africa was a turning point for the government and the nuclear regulator to use social media to help keep people informed    #NRCRIC2019
Moonsamy, NNR : Africa has a record for shutting down social media and it erodes trust in government  #NRCRIC2019
Gino Moonsamy of the South Africa National Nuclear Regulator emphasizes the explosive rise in social media usage across Africa #NRCRIC2019
Hueber, ENSI: Website and social media usage must complement each other in nuclear communication. #NRCRIC2019

Sebastian Hueber, Swiss Federal Nuclear Safety Inspectorate since Fukushima occurred we have learned communication is not just something we do because we have to but it is a part of safety.  #NRCRIC2019
Harrington, NRC: Cultural norms and customs affect which platforms #nuclear regulators use to reach the public and what content they post. #NRCRIC2019
NRC’s Holly Harrington: Billions of internet and social media users mean #nuclear regulators around the world must include these tools in their public communication programs. #NRCRIC2019

For our last session of the #NRCRIC2019, we’re covering: Global Approaches to Using Social Media to Keep the Public Informed about Nuclear Safety. Find speaker presentations for this session at https://t.co/zYNl4ncpxB https://t.co/mIknWlvVW0
Tiippana, STUK: Enhanced regulatory effectiveness & efficiency = enhanced nuclear safety. #RiskInformed #NRCRIC2019

Petteri Tiippana, Director General, STUK, Radiation and Nuclear Safety Authority, Finland: PRA has been used for safety management for three decades. We have increased the use of it in oversight activities over the past few years.  #RiskInformed #NRCRIC2019
FAA's Azevedo: We use risk management to determine appropriate level of oversight of certificate holders and applicants. #RiskInformed #NRCRIC2019
Ann Azevedo from FAA: Benefits of risk management include objective and consistent assessment of unsafe conditions and prioritization of resources across issues. #NRCRIC2019 #RiskInformed
Johnson, NASA GSFC: #RiskInformed requires that we think and we need to relearn the art of thinking. Relearning can lead to a compelling tomorrow #NRCRIC2019

Michael Johnson, NASA Goddard Space Flight Center: We use a risk-based approach to maximize the chance of mission success by focusing on mitigating specific project risks rather than enforcing a set of requirements simply because we always have. #RiskInformed #NRCRIC2019
Greg Krueger, NEI: Risk insights can be used to provide alternate perspectives in support of regulatory and operational decisionmaking. #NRCRIC2019 #RiskInformed.
NRC's Franovich: #RiskInformed decisionmaking is a gateway to transformation. #NRCRIC2019
NRC's Michael Franovich: #RiskInformed decisionmaking is an approach where we're using probabalistic risk assessment and engineering insights to make better regulatory decisions. #NRCRIC2019
Cmr. Caputo: Goal of session is to improve understanding of #RiskInformed decisionmaking and its role in our regulatory processes. #NRCRIC2019

Foy, ONR: Working in isolation is a sure way to fail, regulation cannot be independent of ideas and innovation. #NRCRIC2019
Mark Foy, Chief Nuclear Inspector, Office of Nuclear Regulation, UK: Working with non-governmental organizations promotes confidence in ONR as a robust, independent regulator. #NRCRIC2019

Yasui, Nuclear Regulation Authority, Japan: Avoiding isolation w/o eroding independence is a never-ending challenge. It's critically important for a regulator to continually improve its ways of thinking and doing. #NRCRIC2019

Yasui, Nuclear Regulation Authority, Japan: Transparency is the most effective factor for building credibility with the public, and facilitates development of responsible attitude of both sides. #NRCRIC2019

Masaya Yasui, Secretary-General, Nuclear Regulation Authority, Japan: To be independent a regulator must be separate from promotion and integrate the "3s's" --safety, security and safeguards. #NRCRIC2019
Lachaume, ASN: Independent regulatory body needs-- solid and transparent legal framework, clearly defined processes, competent management program and international cooperation. #NRCRIC2019
Jean-Luc Lachaume, Commissioner, French Nuclear Safety Authority at #NRCRIC2019 emphasizes the importance of active international policy to avoiding isolation and strengthening robustness.
Velshi, CNSC: Our aim in welcoming participation in the regulatory process is to have participants feel the process was fair and their views were considered. #NRCRIC2019
Velshi, CNSC: As an independent regulator, a healthy safety culture must come from the top. #NRCRIC2019

Rumina Velshi, President and CEO, Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission: Three elements are necessary to maintain independence without isolation-- effective governance, engagement and transparency. #NRCRIC2019
NRC's Cmr. Wright: It's important for an independent regulator to consider stakeholder views to make informed decisions and achieve regulatory objectives. #NRCRIC2019

Cmr. Baran: I would be wary of making any radical changes to the Reactor Oversight Process because it has generally been an effective safety framework. #NRCRIC2019

Cmr. Baran: We should not allow licensees to inspect themselves in lieu of #NRC inspections. #NRC works for the American public and have the responsibility to protect their health and safety. #NRCRIC2019

Cmr. Baran: Transformation at #NRC can’t be about rolling back safety and security standards to save money. And it can’t be about fewer inspections or weaker oversight. That would take us in the wrong direction. #NRCRIC2019

Commissioner Baran at #NRCRIC2019: Whether #NRC is considering a major, transformational change or a more modest, incremental change, we must keep our focus squarely on our safety and security mission.
